Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2008 01:23AM Fllorik wrote: I opted not to go on any clincial trials. I wanted the true known treatments. When the only way to get Xeloda/Avastin was to be in a trial, my onc from MD Anderson petitioned my insurance co. and they agreed to pay for the combo . So I receieved it outside the clinicial trial. It was sucessful for almost a year. Please remember when you have an ooph it puts you into immediate menopause. Sometimes that can be rough. If you do chemo- induced or medically- induced menopause, it might be easier on you. Menopause SE are very harsh in addition to treatment SE. Good luck with your decision! And hope you had fun this weekend!

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2008 10:23PM Fllorik wrote: I was on Avastin. You have to monitored very carefully for high blood pressure. It is a major side effect. Easy bruising and cuts are also common. Small blood vessels sometimes just "pop". You don't lose your hair from Avastin and neither will you have the usual nausea and stomach problems. It is very doable.

Posts.Content: Fllorik wrote: Has anyone had paracentsis done in their abdomin? I had it done last week and 2 liters of fluid came out. The onc.said it is a by product of the cancer growinf more rapidly in my liver. The procedure was painful...Next time I will take my own pain meds with me!  She also took me off Doxil and put me on Abraxane/zometa/flasodex. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: paracentsis Fllorik Fllorik

Posts.Content: Fllorik wrote: Could you believe that yesterday, as I was pulling into a handicap parking spot with my permanent handicap decal, a lady pulls up and says that she has been watching me park in that spot for a week. She said I don't look handicapped and I shouldn't be using that spot! I was shocked!!!! I spend alot of time and energy (which I don't have much of) to look "normal" and act "normal". It just blow me away! I didn't know how to react so I just shrugged my shoulders and kept walking! But I can't seem to let go of this incident. I know that she was the ignorant one but it ruined my day....all day! Help me to get over this. Log in to post a reply
